alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 7:57PM CDT until May 18 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL PUTNAM COUNTY... At 757 PM CDT, social media reports indicated flash flooding continues in Algood and Cookeville. Radar estimates and rain gauge reports show up to 6.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past few hours. Although rainfall is now tapering off, flash flooding will continue for another hour before waters recede. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cookeville and Algood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 282 and 295. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
